main event: A series of unidentified flying object sightings were reported by control tower personnel in the New York area on December 1, 1952, involving an object described with varying brightness and colors.
interesting points: The object was reported by multiple control tower operators including Teterboro, Westchester, Newark, LaGuardia, Idlewild, and Mitchell AFB., Observers noted a range of colors including white, orange, and amber, and reported that it had a discernible disk shape., The sightings lasted for approximately 15 minutes, providing time and direction data from various locations., The object was suggested to be the planet Jupiter based on its brightness and position in the sky., No radar tracks were confirmed for the sightings, indicating reliance on visual observation.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object with varying brightness and colors
witness description: Observers were control tower personnel and CAA-rated Airways Operations Specialists with experience in aircraft operations.
